metadata.title: USN-5275-1 -- BlueZ vulnerability
metadata.description: Ziming Zhang discovered that BlueZ incorrectly handled memory write operations in its gatt server. A remote attacker could possibly use this to cause BlueZ to crash leading to a denial of service, or potentially remotely execute code. (CVE-2022-0204)  Update Instructions:  Run `sudo pro fix USN-5275-1` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions:  libbluetooth3 - 5.53-0ubuntu3.5 bluez-tests - 5.53-0ubuntu3.5 bluez-obexd - 5.53-0ubuntu3.5 bluetooth - 5.53-0ubuntu3.5 bluez - 5.53-0ubuntu3.5 bluez-hcidump - 5.53-0ubuntu3.5 bluez-cups - 5.53-0ubuntu3.5 libbluetooth-dev - 5.53-0ubuntu3.5 No subscription required
